reporter_caption.center: O'DONNELL v. TOWN OF WESTFIELD, 117 N.J. Eq. 422 (1935)

caption.center: BRIDGET O'DONNELL, complainant-respondent, v. TOWN OF WESTFIELD et al.,

opinion.posture: On appeal from an order advised by Vice-Chancellor Berry, denying application to dismiss the bill of complaint as amended, for lack of equity.
opinion.attorneys:
Mr. Paul Q. Oliver, for the appellants.
Mr. S. Arthur Stern, for the respondent.
opinion.opinion_text:
We conclude that the bill shows sufficient equity to justify its retention; and that is the only question before us at this time.Page 423
Certain ad interim restraint was awarded, but the order of the court of chancery in that regard is not before us, and we express no opinion on it.
The order under review is affirmed.
For affirmance — THE CHIEF-JUSTICE, PARKER, LLOYD, CASE, BODINE, DONGES, HEHER, PERSKIE, VAN BUSKIRK, KAYS, HETFIELD, DEAR, WELLS, JJ. 13.
For reversal — None.
